name: Bora Bora Pearl Beach Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bora Bora Pearl resort is spectacular! Our whole stay from getting off the plane til getting back on the plane was excellent. The staff greeted us at the airport, gave us tags to put on our luggage, and they took care of everything. We checked in with at least 10 other couples, and the process was seamless.
reviews.title: Beyond Words

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The activity desk was VERY good at what they do. You just tell them what you want and when, and they arrange EVERYTHING. You just have to show up at the boat dock at the designated time.
reviews.title: Paradise!!!! Best vacation ever! -

reviews.text: We stayed in bungalow #34 (premium overwater bungalow). Definitely worth the extra $100 a day. The room was clean, towels, soap, etc was replenished at least twice a day without asking. Room was spacious, AC was strong.

reviews.text: Some guide books say getting to the main village of Vaitape was difficult. I think it is just fine. They have boat and bus shuttles waiting, so the inconvenience was minimal if any.
reviews.title: The best place we have ever been!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent our honeymoon in Bora Bora and stayed at the Pearl Beach resort for 9 days. It was absolutely amazing! We stayed in the premium over the water bungalow #39. It was a great location because there was an ice hut right next store which caused a ton of space between our hut and the other hut next store. Any over the water hut will be amazing though. Fish swim by all day and we even had sting rays swim by a few times and saw sharks at night.
reviews.title: We had the time of our lives!!!

likes.liked: — The amazing view and water from OWB! Great place to relax.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Pearl in early April 2007 for our honeymoon. It seemed like everyone else in Bora Bora was honeymooners too! We stayed for about a week at the pearl resort in one of their overwater bungalows #13. This was probably one of the best non-premium bungalows to be had. I would suggest staying in an overwater bungalow the whole time - the mosquitos can get to you on land!
reviews.title: Honeymoon to remember!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was extremely nice and everything was super clean. Everything was extremely beautiful. The side of the island that the pearl is on seems to be the better side of the island to stay on according the locals. There is much less of a current on the side the pearl is on. Also it's easier to get to the main city of vaitape on the side of the pearl. The other resorts (i.e. the st. regis, the four season) seem to be on the back side of the island.
reviews.title: at a loss for words

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived in BB (on an Air Tahiti flight from Moorea), we met the rep from the Pearl and got a lei. We picked up our luggage, gave it to the porter, and then boarded the boat for the Pearl. It was less than a 10-minute ride to the resort. When we docked, we were given some lemonade and a vanilla scented towel that I loved the smell of. Check-in was very easy and well organized. We hung back by the excursions desk to book some trips (parasailing and shark feeding) that I wanted to do during the week. We also asked the concierges to confirm our reservation at Villa Mahana that I had made via email on my own and about other restaurants on the island.
reviews.title: Magical, don't stay anywhere else!

likes.liked: — Quality of the rooms, location, water, views...everything you want Bora Bora to be.

aka: Bora Bora Pearl Beach Resort And Spa
description: The BORA BORA PEARL BEACH RESORT & SPA, member of The Leading Hotels of the World, is located on Motu Tevairoa facing the island of Bora Bora. It offers a place to luxuriate in the peace and tranquility of the magical surroundings with unsurpassed views on the world renowned Mount Otemanu.This traditional Polynesian style hotel is located 10 minutes by private boat from the airport and 15 minutes from Vaitape, the main village of Bora Bora. It offers 50 over water bungalows, 10 beach suites and 20 garden pool suites.All feature ceiling fan, air conditioning, coffee & tea making facilities, mini bar, hair dryer, safety box, iron and table,magnifying mirror, 20” LCD satellite television with DVD player, IDD telephone, CD player.In addition, the over water bungalows have glass tables to view the aquatic life of the lagoon, a large sundeck and sitting area with direct access to the water. The beach suites offer a lounge area facing the beach and a private enclosed garden with Jacuzzi. The garden & premium pool suites feature a private tropical garden, plunge pool and a spacious covered sitting & resting area.The hotel has 3 restaurants, 2 bars, 1 boutique, an on-site diving centre - the Blue Nui Dive Center, a fresh water swimming pool, one floodlit tennis court, mini golf, table tennis, volley ball court and bacci ball court, billiards and a wide variety of activities and excursions.Beside the hotel’s overwater bungalows is a coral nursery called To’A Nui. Since the creation of the nursery more than 70 species of fish have settled and developed in this unique environment. The park allows a colony of 4000 corals to regenerate in perfect ecological conditions. Our guests can freely discover this unique place (snorkeling) and live an unforgettable experience.The Manea Spa covers an area in 675 sq meters and combines traditional Tahitian architecture with state of the art equipments and facilities: 2 double and 1 single massage rooms, 1 VIP spa suite, 1 double Vichy shower, 1 beauty & tattoo salon, 2 saunas, 2 steam bath and a fully equipped fitness room.
